noun.description: The conditions under which land or buildings are held or occupied.

examples: his tenure of the premiership would be threatened

noun.description: Guaranteed permanent employment, especially as a teacher or professor, after a probationary period.

verb.description: Give (someone) a permanent post, especially as a teacher or professor.
examples: I had recently been tenured and then promoted to full professor

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from tenir to hold, from Latin tenere.
